Oscillating functions: modelling tides

We consider how the function

\[\qquad h = 3.2 \sin (2.7t + 8.5)\]

might be used to model the rise and fall of the tide in a harbour. The figure below shows a graph of this function for \((0\ge t \ge 5)\).


We consider some aspects of this graph and model. It seems reasonable to suppose that the tide creates an oscillation of the water level in the harbour of \(h\)m about some mean value represented on the graph by \(h = 0\). There seems to be a low tide near \(t = 1\) and another low tide just after \(t = 3\). Since we expect intervals of 12 to 14 hours between low tides around the U.K., this suggests that time in this graph is specified in 6-hour intervals.
